name: proxmoxve
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Proxmox Virtual Environment cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`proxmox` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Proxmox Virtual Environment cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-proxmoxve` repo](https://github.com/muhlba91/pulumi-proxmoxve/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-proxmox` repo](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox/issues).

apiToken.description: The API token for the Proxmox VE API.

authTicket.description: The pre-authenticated Ticket for the Proxmox VE API.

csrfPreventionToken.description: The pre-authenticated CSRF Prevention Token for the Proxmox VE API.

endpoint.description: The endpoint for the Proxmox VE API.

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step.

minTls.description: The minimum required TLS version for API calls.Supported values: `1.0|1.1|1.2|1.3`. Defaults to `1.3`.

otp.description: The one-time password for the Proxmox VE API.
otp.deprecationMessage: The `otp` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `api_token` attribute instead.

password.description: The password for the Proxmox VE API.

randomVmIdEnd.description: The ending number for random VM / Container IDs.

randomVmIdStart.description: The starting number for random VM / Container IDs.

randomVmIds.description: Whether to generate random VM / Container IDs.

ssh.description: The SSH configuration for the Proxmox nodes.

username.description: The username for the Proxmox VE API.

contacts.description: An array of contact email addresses.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the account creation.

status.description: The status of the account. Can be one of `valid`, `deactivated` or `revoked`.

digest.description: Prevent changes if current configuration file has a different digest. This can be used to prevent concurrent modifications.

type.description: ACME challenge type (dns, standalone).

validationDelay.description: Extra delay in seconds to wait before requesting validation. Allows to cope with a long TTL of DNS records (0 - 172800).

datastoreId.description: The identifier for the target datastore.

nodeName.description: The name of the source node (leave blank, if equal to the `node_name` argument).

vmId.description: The identifier for the source container.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the console device (defaults to `true`).

ttyCount.description: The number of available TTY (defaults to `2`).

type.description: The console mode (defaults to `tty`).

architecture.description: The CPU architecture (defaults to `amd64`).

cores.description: The number of CPU cores (defaults to `1`).

units.description: The CPU units (defaults to `1024`).

denyWrite.description: Deny the container to write to the device (defaults to `false`).

gid.description: Group ID to be assigned to the device node.

mode.description:
Access mode to be set on the device node. Must be a
4-digit octal number.

path.description: Device to pass through to the container (e.g. `/dev/sda`).

uid.description: User ID to be assigned to the device node.

acl.description: Explicitly enable or disable ACL support

datastoreId.description: The identifier for the datastore to create the disk in (defaults to `local`).

quota.description: Enable user quotas for the container rootfs

replicate.description: Will include this volume to a storage replica job

size.description: The size of the root filesystem in gigabytes (defaults to `4`). When set to 0 a directory or zfs/btrfs subvolume will be created. Requires `datastore_id` to be set.

fuse.description: Whether the container supports FUSE mounts (defaults to `false`)

keyctl.description: Whether the container supports `keyctl()` system call (defaults to `false`)

mounts.description: List of allowed mount types (`cifs` or `nfs`)

nesting.description: Whether the container is nested (defaults to `false`)

ipConfigs.description:
The IP configuration (one block per network
device).

server.description: The DNS server. The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.
server.deprecationMessage: The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.

address.description: The IPv4 address in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.2.2/24). Alternatively, set this to `dhcp` for autodiscovery.

gateway.description: The IPv4 gateway (must be omitted when `dhcp` is used as the address).

address.description: The IPv6 address in CIDR notation (e.g. fd1c::7334/64). Alternatively, set this to `dhcp` for DHCPv6, or `auto` for SLAAC.

gateway.description: The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted when `dhcp` or `auto` are used as the address).

keys.description: The SSH keys for the root account.

password.description: The password for the root account.

dedicated.description: The dedicated memory in megabytes (defaults to `512`).

swap.description: The swap size in megabytes (defaults to `0`).

acl.description: Explicitly enable or disable ACL support.

backup.description: Whether to include the mount point in backups (only used for volume mount points, defaults to `false`).

path.description:
Path to the mount point as seen from inside the
container.

quota.description:
Enable user quotas inside the container (not supported
with ZFS subvolumes).

replicate.description: Will include this volume to a storage replica job.

shared.description:
Mark this non-volume mount point as available on all
nodes.

size.description:
Volume size (only for volume mount points).
Can be specified with a unit suffix (e.g. `10G`).

volume.description:
Volume, device or directory to mount into the
container.

bridge.description: The name of the network bridge (defaults to `vmbr0`).

enabled.description: Whether to enable the network device (defaults to `true`).

firewall.description: Whether this interface's firewall rules should be used (defaults to `false`).

mtu.description:
Maximum transfer unit of the interface. Cannot be
larger than the bridge's MTU.

name.description: The network interface name.

rateLimit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second.

templateFileId.description: The identifier for an OS template file. The ID format is `:/`, for example `local:iso/jammy-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz`. Can be also taken from `proxmoxve.Download.File` resource, or from the output of `pvesm list `.

type.description: The type (defaults to `unmanaged`).

downDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next container is shut down.

order.description:
A non-negative number defining the general startup
order.

upDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next container is started.

ipv4.description: Wait for at least one IPv4 address (non-loopback, non-link-local) (defaults to `false`).

ipv6.description: Wait for at least one IPv6 address (non-loopback, non-link-local) (defaults to `false`). When `wait_for_ip` is not specified or both `ipv4` and `ipv6` are `false`, the provider waits for any valid global unicast address (IPv4 or IPv6). In dual-stack networks where DHCPv6 responds faster, this may result in only IPv6 addresses being available. Set `ipv4 = true` to ensure IPv4 address availability.

lower.description: The minimum number for the next free VM ID. Must be higher or equal to 100

upper.description: The maximum number for the next free VM ID. Must be less or equal to 999999999

haFencingMode.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the HA fencing mode. Must be `always` | `never`.

haFencingTarget.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the HA fencing target.

packageUpdates.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for package updates. Must be `auto` | `always` | `never`.

packageUpdatesTarget.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the package updates target.

replication.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for replication. Must be `always` | `never`.

replicationTarget.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the replication target.

mappingId.description: The corresponding hardware mapping ID of the node check diagnostic entry.

message.description: The message of the node check diagnostic entry.

severity.description: The severity of the node check diagnostic entry.

node.description: The node this mapping applies to.

path.description: The path of the map. For directory mappings the path is required and refers to the POSIX path of the directory as visible from the node.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped PCI device.

id.description: The ID of the map.

iommuGroup.description: The IOMMU group of the map. Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set

node.description: The node name of the map.

subsystemId.description: The subsystem ID group of the map. Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set

comment.description: The comment of the mapped USB device.

id.description: The ID of the map.

node.description: The node name of the map.

path.description: The path of the map. For hardware mappings of type USB the path is optional and indicates that the device is mapped through the device ID instead of ports.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped PCI device.

id.description: The ID attribute of the map.

iommuGroup.description: The IOMMU group attribute of the map.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped USB device.

id.description: The ID attribute of the map.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

name.description: Network/IP specification in CIDR format.

nomatch.description: Entries marked as `nomatch` are skipped as if those were not added to the set.

burst.description: Initial burst of packages which will always get logged before the rate is applied (defaults to `5`).

enabled.description: Enable or disable the log rate limit.

rate.description:
Frequency with which the burst bucket gets refilled
(defaults to `1/second`).

dest.description:
Restrict packet destination address. This can
refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP
alias definition. You can also specify an address range
like `20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99`, or a list of IP addresses and
networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4
and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

dport.description:
Restrict TCP/UDP destination port. You can use
service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined
in `/etc/services`. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for
example `80:85`, and you can use comma separated list to match
several ports or ranges.

enabled.description: Enable this rule. Defaults to `true`.

iface.description:
Network interface name. You have to use network
configuration key names for VMs and containers ('net\d+'). Host
related rules can use arbitrary strings.

log.description: Log level for this rule (`emerg`, `alert`, `crit`, `err`, `warning`, `notice`, `info`, `debug`, `nolog`).

macro.description:
Macro name. Use predefined standard macro
from <https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#_firewall_macro_definitions>

pos.description: Position of the rule in the list.

proto.description:
Restrict packet protocol. You can use protocol
names as defined in '/etc/protocols'.

source.description:
Restrict packet source address. This can refer
to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias
definition. You can also specify an address range
like `20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99`, or a list of IP addresses and
networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4
and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

sport.description:
Restrict TCP/UDP source port. You can use
service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined
in `/etc/services`. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for
example `80:85`, and you can use comma separated list to match
several ports or ranges.

changed.description: Whether the source file has changed since the last run

checksum.description: The SHA256 checksum of the source file.

fileName.description:
The file name to use instead of the source file
name. Useful when the source file does not have a valid file extension,
for example when the source file is a URL referencing a `.qcow2` image.

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step for HTTPS sources (defaults to `false`).

The minimum required TLS version for HTTPS
sources. "Supported values: `1.0|1.1|1.2|1.3` (defaults to `1.3`).

path.description: A path to a local file or a URL.

resize.description: The number of bytes to resize the file to.

enabled.description: Whether the store is enabled.

id.description: The ID of the store.

nodeName.description: The name of the node the store is on.

type.description: Store type.

contentTypes.description: Only list stores with the given content types.

id.description: Only list stores with the given ID.

target.description: If `target` is different to `node_name`, then only lists shared stores which content is accessible on this node and the specified `target` node.

fileId.description: The file ID of the CD-ROM, or `cdrom|none`. Defaults to `none` to leave the CD-ROM empty. Use `cdrom` to connect to the physical drive.

id.description: The ID of the VM to clone.

retries.description: The number of retries to perform when cloning the VM (default: 3).

affinity.description: The CPU cores that are used to run the VMs vCPU. The value is a list of CPU IDs, separated by commas. The CPU IDs are zero-based. For example, `0,1,2,3` (which also can be shortened to `0-3`) means that the VMs vCPUs are run on the first four CPU cores. Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

architecture.description: The CPU architecture `` (defaults to the host). Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket (defaults to `1`).

flags.description: Set of additional CPU flags. Use `+FLAG` to enable, `-FLAG` to disable a flag. Custom CPU models can specify any flag supported by QEMU/KVM, VM-specific flags must be from the following set for security reasons: `pcid`, `spec-ctrl`, `ibpb`, `ssbd`, `virt-ssbd`, `amd-ssbd`, `amd-no-ssb`, `pdpe1gb`, `md-clear`, `hv-tlbflush`, `hv-evmcs`, `aes`.

hotplugged.description: The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage (defaults to `0` which means no limit).

numa.description: Enable NUMA (defaults to `false`).

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

type.description: Emulated CPU type, it's recommended to use `x86-64-v2-AES` or higher (defaults to `kvm64`). See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm*virtual*machines_settings for more information.

units.description: CPU weight for a VM. Argument is used in the kernel fair scheduler. The larger the number is, the more CPU time this VM gets. Number is relative to weights of all the other running VMs.

maxBytes.description: Maximum bytes of entropy allowed to get injected into the guest every period. Use 0 to disable limiting (potentially dangerous).

period.description: Period in milliseconds to limit entropy injection to the guest. Use 0 to disable limiting (potentially dangerous).

source.description: The file on the host to gather entropy from. In most cases, `/dev/urandom` should be preferred over `/dev/random` to avoid entropy-starvation issues on the host.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

clipboard.description: Enable a specific clipboard. If not set, depending on the display type the SPICE one will be added. Currently only `vnc` is available. Migration with VNC clipboard is not supported by Proxmox.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (4-512 MB). Has no effect with serial display.

type.description: The VGA type (defaults to `std`).

enabled.description: Whether to enable the QEMU agent (defaults to `false`).

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for data from the QEMU agent to become available ( defaults to `15m`).

trim.description: Whether to enable the FSTRIM feature in the QEMU agent (defaults to `false`).

type.description: The QEMU agent interface type (defaults to `virtio`).

waitForIp.description: Configuration for waiting for specific IP address types when the VM starts.

ipv4.description: Wait for at least one IPv4 address (non-loopback, non-link-local) (defaults to `false`).

ipv6.description: Wait for at least one IPv6 address (non-loopback, non-link-local) (defaults to `false`). When `wait_for_ip` is not specified or both `ipv4` and `ipv6` are `false`, the provider waits for any valid global unicast address (IPv4 or IPv6). In dual-stack networks where DHCPv6 responds faster, this may result in only IPv6 addresses being available. Set `ipv4 = true` to ensure IPv4 address availability.

allowSmt.description: Sets policy bit to allow Simultaneous Multi Threading (SMT) (Ignored unless for SEV-SNP) (defaults to `true`).

kernelHashes.description: Add kernel hashes to guest firmware for measured linux kernel launch (defaults to `false`).

noDebug.description: Sets policy bit to disallow debugging of guest (defaults to `false`).

noKeySharing.description: Sets policy bit to disallow key sharing with other guests (Ignored for SEV-SNP) (defaults to `false`). The `amd_sev` setting is only allowed for a `root@pam` authenticated user.

type.description: Enable standard SEV with `std` or enable experimental SEV-ES with the `es` option or enable experimental SEV-SNP with the `snp` option (defaults to `std`).

device.description:
The device (defaults to `intel-hda`).
- `AC97` - Intel 82801AA AC97 Audio.
- `ich9-intel-hda` - Intel HD Audio Controller (ich9).
- `intel-hda` - Intel HD Audio.

driver.description: The driver (defaults to `spice`).

enabled.description: Whether to enable the audio device (defaults to `true`).
Whether to enable the CD-ROM drive (defaults to `false`). *Deprecated*. The attribute will be removed in the next version of the provider. Set `file_id` to `none` to leave the CD-ROM drive empty.
enabled.deprecationMessage: Remove this attribute's configuration as it is no longer used and the attribute will be removed in the next version of the provider. Set `file_id` to `none` to leave the CDROM drive empty.

fileId.description: A file ID for an ISO file (defaults to `cdrom` as in the physical drive). Use `none` to leave the CD-ROM drive empty.

interface.description: A hardware interface to connect CD-ROM drive to (defaults to `ide3`). "Must be one of `ideN`, `sataN`, `scsiN`, where N is the index of the interface. " + "Note that `q35` machine type only supports `ide0` and `ide2` of IDE interfaces.

datastoreId.description: The identifier for the target datastore.

full.description: Full or linked clone (defaults to `true`).

nodeName.description: The name of the source node (leave blank, if equal to the `node_name` argument).

retries.description:
Number of retries in Proxmox for clone vm.
Sometimes Proxmox errors with timeout when creating multiple clones at
once.

vmId.description: The identifier for the source VM.

affinity.description: The CPU cores that are used to run the VMs vCPU. The value is a list of CPU IDs, separated by commas. The CPU IDs are zero-based. For example, `0,1,2,3` (which also can be shortened to `0-3`) means that the VMs vCPUs are run on the first four CPU cores. Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

architecture.description: The CPU architecture (defaults to `x86_64`).

cores.description: The number of CPU cores (defaults to `1`).

flags.description:
The CPU flags.
- `+aes`/`-aes` - Activate AES instruction set for HW acceleration.
- `+amd-no-ssb`/`-amd-no-ssb` - Notifies guest OS that host is not
vulnerable for Spectre on AMD CPUs.
- `+amd-ssbd`/`-amd-ssbd` - Improves Spectre mitigation performance with
AMD CPUs, best used with "virt-ssbd".
- `+hv-evmcs`/`-hv-evmcs` - Improve performance for nested
virtualization (only supported on Intel CPUs).
- `+hv-tlbflush`/`-hv-tlbflush` - Improve performance in overcommitted
Windows guests (may lead to guest BSOD on old CPUs).
- `+ibpb`/`-ibpb` - Allows improved Spectre mitigation on AMD CPUs.
- `+md-clear`/`-md-clear` - Required to let the guest OS know if MDS is
mitigated correctly.
- `+pcid`/`-pcid` - Meltdown fix cost reduction on Westmere, Sandy- and
Ivy Bridge Intel CPUs.
- `+pdpe1gb`/`-pdpe1gb` - Allows guest OS to use 1 GB size pages, if
host HW supports it.
- `+spec-ctrl`/`-spec-ctrl` - Allows improved Spectre mitigation with
Intel CPUs.
- `+ssbd`/`-ssbd` - Protection for "Speculative Store Bypass" for Intel
models.
- `+virt-ssbd`/`-virt-ssbd` - Basis for "Speculative Store Bypass"
protection for AMD models.

hotplugged.description: The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage, `0...128`. (defaults to `0` -- no limit).

numa.description: Enable/disable NUMA. (default to `false`)

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

type.description: The emulated CPU type, it's recommended to use `x86-64-v2-AES` (defaults to `qemu64`).

units.description: The CPU units (defaults to `1024`).

aio.description: The disk AIO mode (defaults to `io_uring`).

backup.description: Whether the drive should be included when making backups (defaults to `true`).

cache.description: The cache type (defaults to `none`).

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create
the disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

discard.description: Whether to pass discard/trim requests to the underlying storage. Supported values are `on`/`ignore` (defaults to `ignore`).

fileId.description: The file ID for a disk image when importing a disk into VM. The ID format is `:/`, for example `local:iso/centos8.img`. Can be also taken from `proxmoxve.Download.File` resource. *Deprecated*, use `import_from` instead.

importFrom.description: The file ID for a disk image to import into VM. The image must be of `import` content type. The ID format is `:import/`, for example `local:import/centos8.qcow2`. Can be also taken from a disk replacement operation, which will require a VM reboot. Your original disks will remain as detached disks.

interface.description: The disk interface for Proxmox, currently `scsi`, `sata` and `virtio` interfaces are supported. Append the disk index at the end, for example, `virtio0` for the first virtio disk, `virtio1` for the second, etc.

iothread.description: Whether to use iothreads for this disk (defaults to `false`).

pathInDatastore.description: The in-datastore path to the disk image. ***Experimental.***Use to attach another VM's disks, or (as root only) host's filesystem paths (`datastore_id` empty string). See "*Example: Attached disks*".

replicate.description: Whether the drive should be considered for replication jobs (defaults to `true`).

serial.description: The serial number of the disk, up to 20 bytes long.

size.description: The disk size in gigabytes (defaults to `8`).

ssd.description: Whether to use an SSD emulation option for this disk ( defaults to `false`). Note that SSD emulation is not supported on VirtIO Block drives.

iopsRead.description: The maximum read I/O in operations per second.

iopsReadBurstable.description: The maximum unthrottled read I/O pool in operations per second.

iopsWrite.description: The maximum write I/O in operations per second.

iopsWriteBurstable.description: The maximum unthrottled write I/O pool in operations per second.

read.description: The maximum read speed in megabytes per second.

readBurstable.description:
The maximum burstable read speed in
megabytes per second.

write.description: The maximum write speed in megabytes per second.

writeBurstable.description:
The maximum burstable write speed in
megabytes per second.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create
the disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

fileFormat.description: The file format (defaults to `raw`).

preEnrolledKeys.description: Use am EFI vars template with distribution-specific and Microsoft Standard keys enrolled, if used with EFI type=`4m`. Ignored for VMs with cpu.architecture=`aarch64` (defaults to `false`).

type.description: Size and type of the OVMF EFI disk. `4m` is newer and recommended, and required for Secure Boot. For backwards compatibility use `2m`. Ignored for VMs with cpu.architecture=`aarch64` (defaults to `2m`).

device.description:
The PCI device name for Proxmox, in form
of `hostpciX` where `X` is a sequential number from 0 to 15.

id.description: The PCI device ID. This parameter is not compatible with `api_token` and requires the root `username` and `password` configured in the proxmox provider. Use either this or `mapping`.

mapping.description: The resource mapping name of the device, for example gpu. Use either this or `id`.

mdev.description: The mediated device ID to use.

pcie.description:
Tells Proxmox to use a PCIe or PCI port. Some
guests/device combination require PCIe rather than PCI. PCIe is only
available for q35 machine types.

romFile.description:
A path to a ROM file for the device to use. This
is a relative path under `/usr/share/kvm/`.

rombar.description: Makes the firmware ROM visible for the VM (defaults to `true`).

xvga.description: Marks the PCI(e) device as the primary GPU of the VM. With this enabled the `vga` configuration argument will be ignored.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

interface.description: The hardware interface to connect the cloud-init image to. Must be one of `ide0..3`, `sata0..5`, `scsi0..30`. Will be detected if the setting is missing but a cloud-init image is present, otherwise defaults to `ide2`.

ipConfigs.description:
The IP configuration (one block per network
device).

metaDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
all meta data passed to the VM via cloud-init.

networkDataFileId.description: The identifier for a file containing network configuration data passed to the VM via cloud-init (conflicts with `ip_config`).

type.description: The cloud-init configuration format

userAccount.description: The user account configuration (conflicts with `user_data_file_id`).

userDataFileId.description: The identifier for a file containing custom user data (conflicts with `user_account`).

vendorDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
all vendor data passed to the VM via cloud-init.

address.description: The IPv4 address in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.2.2/24). Alternatively, set this to `dhcp` for autodiscovery.

gateway.description: The IPv4 gateway (must be omitted when `dhcp` is used as the address).

address.description: The IPv6 address in CIDR notation (e.g. fd1c::7334/64). Alternatively, set this to `dhcp` for DHCPv6, or `auto` for SLAAC.

gateway.description: The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted when `dhcp` or `auto` are used as the address).

dedicated.description: The dedicated memory in megabytes (defaults to `512`).

floating.description: The floating memory in megabytes. The default is `0`, which disables "ballooning device" for the VM. Please note that Proxmox has ballooning enabled by default. To enable it, set `floating` to the same value as `dedicated`. See [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_memory) section 10.2.6 for more information.

keepHugepages.description: Keep hugepages memory after the VM is stopped (defaults to `false`). Settings `hugepages` and `keep_hugepages` are only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user. And required `cpu.numa` to be enabled.

shared.description: The shared memory in megabytes (defaults to `0`).

bridge.description: The name of the network bridge (defaults to `vmbr0`).

disconnected.description: Whether to disconnect the network device from the network (defaults to `false`).

enabled.description: Whether to enable the network device (defaults to `true`).

firewall.description: Whether this interface's firewall rules should be used (defaults to `false`).

model.description: The network device model (defaults to `virtio`).

mtu.description: Force MTU, for VirtIO only. Set to 1 to use the bridge MTU. Cannot be larger than the bridge MTU.

queues.description: The number of queues for VirtIO (1..64).

rateLimit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second.

trunks.description:
String containing a `;` separated list of VLAN trunks
("10;20;30"). Note that the VLAN-aware feature need to be enabled on the PVE
Linux Bridge to use trunks.

cpus.description: The CPU cores to assign to the NUMA node (format is `0-7;16-31`).

device.description:
The NUMA device name for Proxmox, in form
of `numaX` where `X` is a sequential number from 0 to 7.

memory.description: The memory in megabytes to assign to the NUMA node.

policy.description: The NUMA policy (defaults to `preferred`).

type.description: The type (defaults to `other`).

maxBytes.description: Maximum bytes of entropy allowed to get injected into the guest every `period` milliseconds (defaults to `1024`). Prefer a lower value when using `/dev/random` as source.

period.description: Every `period` milliseconds the entropy-injection quota is reset, allowing the guest to retrieve another `max_bytes` of entropy (defaults to `1000`).

source.description: The file on the host to gather entropy from. In most cases, `/dev/urandom` should be preferred over `/dev/random` to avoid entropy-starvation issues on the host.

device.description: The device (defaults to `socket`). - `/dev/*` - A host serial device.

uuid.description: The UUID (defaults to randomly generated UUID).

downDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next VM is shut down.

order.description:
A non-negative number defining the general startup
order.

upDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next VM is started.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create
the disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

version.description:
TPM state device version. Can be `v1.2` or `v2.0`.
(defaults to `v2.0`).

host.description: The Host USB device or port or the value `spice`. Use either this or `mapping`.

mapping.description: The cluster-wide resource mapping name of the device, for example "usbdevice". Use either this or `host`.

usb3.description: Makes the USB device a USB3 device for the VM (defaults to `false`).

clipboard.description: Enable VNC clipboard by setting to `vnc`. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (defaults to `16`).

type.description: The VGA type (defaults to `std`).

exposeAcl.description: Enable POSIX ACLs, implies xattr support

action.description: The action to perform if after activation the guest fails to poll the watchdog in time (defaults to `none`).

enabled.description: Whether the watchdog is enabled (defaults to `false`).

model.description: The watchdog type to emulate (defaults to `i6300esb`).

name.description: Name of the VM attribute to filter on. One of [`name`, `template`, `status`, `node_name`]

values.description: List of values to pass the filter. VM's attribute should match at least one value in the list.

name.description: The virtual machine name.

nodeName.description: The node name. All cluster nodes will be queried in case this is omitted

tags.description:
A list of tags to filter the VMs. The VM must have all
the tags to be included in the result.

template.description: Whether the VM is a template.

agent.description: Whether to use the SSH agent for authentication. Takes precedence over the `private_key` and `password` fields. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_AGENT` environment variable, or `false` if not set.

agentForwarding.description: Whether to enable SSH agent forwarding. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_AGENT_FORWARDING` environment variable, or `false` if not set.

agentSocket.description: The path to the SSH agent socket. Defaults to the value of the `SSH_AUTH_SOCK` environment variable.

nodes.description: Overrides for SSH connection configuration for a Proxmox VE node.

password.description: The password used for the SSH connection. Defaults to the value of the `password` field of the `provider` block.

privateKey.description: The unencrypted private key (in PEM format) used for the SSH connection. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` environment variable.

socks5Password.description: The password for the SOCKS5 proxy server. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_SOCKS5_PASSWORD` environment variable.

socks5Server.description: The address:port of the SOCKS5 proxy server. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_SOCKS5_SERVER` environment variable.

socks5Username.description: The username for the SOCKS5 proxy server. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_SOCKS5_USERNAME` environment variable.

username.description: The username used for the SSH connection. Defaults to the value of the `username` field of the `provider` block.

port.description: The port of the Proxmox VE node.

type.description: Emulated CPU type.

source.description: The entropy source for the RNG device.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (4-512 MB). Has no effect with serial display.

type.description: The VGA type.

provider.description:
The provider type for the proxmox package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

started.description: Whether to start the container (defaults to `true`).

startup.description: Defines startup and shutdown behavior of the container.

bandwidthLimitMigration.description: Migration I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidthLimitMove.description: Move I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidthLimitRestore.description: Restore I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

console.description: Select the default Console viewer. Must be `applet` | `vv`| `html5` | `xtermjs`. You can either use the builtin java applet (VNC; deprecated and maps to html5), an external virt-viewer compatible application (SPICE), an HTML5 based vnc viewer (noVNC), or an HTML5 based console client (xtermjs). If the selected viewer is not available (e.g. SPICE not activated for the VM), the fallback is noVNC.

crsHa.description: Cluster resource scheduling setting for HA. Must be `static` | `basic` (default is `basic`).

crsHaRebalanceOnStart.description: Cluster resource scheduling setting for HA rebalance on start.

description.description: Datacenter description. Shown in the web-interface datacenter notes panel. This is saved as comment inside the configuration file.

emailFrom.description: email address to send notification from (default is root@$hostname).

haShutdownPolicy.description: Cluster wide HA shutdown policy (). Must be `freeze` | `failover` | `migrate` | `conditional` (default is `conditional`).

httpProxy.description: Specify external http proxy which is used for downloads (example: `http://username:password@host:port/`).

keyboard.description: Default keyboard layout for vnc server. Must be `de` | `de-ch` | `da` | `en-gb` | `en-us` | `es` | `fi` | `fr` | `fr-be` | `fr-ca` | `fr-ch` | `hu` | `is` | `it` | `ja` | `lt` | `mk` | `nl` | `no` | `pl` | `pt` | `pt-br` | `sv` | `sl` | `tr`.

language.description: Default GUI language. Must be `ca` | `da` | `de` | `en` | `es` | `eu` | `fa` | `fr` | `he` | `it` | `ja` | `nb` | `nn` | `pl` | `pt_BR` | `ru` | `sl` | `sv` | `tr` | `zh_CN` | `zh_TW`.

maxWorkers.description: Defines how many workers (per node) are maximal started on actions like 'stopall VMs' or task from the ha-manager.

migrationType.description: Cluster wide migration type. Must be `secure` | `insecure` (default is `secure`).

nextId.description: The ranges for the next free VM ID auto-selection pool.

bandwidthLimitDefault.description: Default I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidthLimitMove.description: Move I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

You can either use the builtin java applet (VNC; deprecated and maps to html5), an external virt-viewer compatible application (SPICE), an HTML5 based vnc viewer (noVNC), or an HTML5 based console client (xtermjs). If the selected viewer is not available (e.g. SPICE not activated for the VM), the fallback is noVNC.

fileName.description: The file name. If not provided, it is calculated using `url`. PVE will raise 'wrong file extension' error for some popular extensions file `.raw` or `.qcow2` on PVE versions prior to 8.4. Workaround is to use e.g. `.img` instead.

overwrite.description: By default `true`. If `true` and file size has changed in the datastore, it will be replaced. If `false`, there will be no check.

overwriteUnmanaged.description: If `true` and a file with the same name already exists in the datastore, it will be deleted and the new file will be downloaded. If `false` and the file already exists, an error will be returned.

uploadTimeout.description: The file download timeout seconds. Default is 600 (10min).

url.description: The URL to download the file from. Must match regex: `https?://.*`.

contentType.description:
The content type. If not specified, the content
type will be inferred from the file extension. Valid values are:

fileMode.description: The file mode in octal format, e.g. `0700` or `600`. Note that the prefixes `0o` and `0x` is not supported! Setting this attribute is also only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite an existing file (defaults to `true`).

sourceFile.description: The source file (conflicts with `source_raw`), could be a local file or a URL. If the source file is a URL, the file will be downloaded and stored locally before uploading it to Proxmox VE.

sourceRaw.description: The raw source (conflicts with `source_file`).

timeoutUpload.description:
Timeout for uploading ISO/VSTMPL files in
seconds (defaults to 1800).

proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine2:VirtualMach.description:
!> **DO NOT USE** This is an experimental implementation of a Proxmox VM resource using Plugin Framework.

It is a Proof of Concept, highly experimental and **will** change in future. It does not support all features of the Proxmox API for VMs and **MUST NOT** be used in production. > Many attributes are marked as **optional** _and_ **computed** in the schema, hence you may seem added to the plan with "(known after apply)" status, even if they are not set in the configuration. This is done to support the `clone` operation, when a VM is created from an existing VM or template, and the source attributes are copied to the clone.

Computed attributes allow the provider to set those attributes without user input. The attributes are also marked as optional to allow the practitioner to set (or overwrite) them if needed.

cdrom.description: The CD-ROM configuration. The key is the interface of the CD-ROM, could be one of `ideN`, `sataN`, `scsiN`, where N is the index of the interface. Note that `q35` machine type only supports `ide0` and `ide2` of IDE interfaces.

deleteUnreferencedDisksOnDestroy.description: Set to true to delete unreferenced disks on destroy (defaults to `true`).

name.description: The name of the VM. Doesn't have to be unique.

nodeName.description: The name of the node where the VM is provisioned.

purgeOnDestroy.description: Set to true to purge the VM from backup configurations on destroy (defaults to `true`).

rng.description: Configure the RNG (Random Number Generator) device. The RNG device provides entropy to guests to ensure good quality random numbers for guest applications that require them. Can only be set by `root@pam.`See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) for more information.

stopOnDestroy.description: Set to true to stop (rather than shutdown) the VM on destroy (defaults to `false`).

tags.description: The tags assigned to the VM.

template.description: Set to true to create a VM template.

vga.description: Configure the VGA Hardware. If you want to use high resolution modes (>= 1280x1024x16) you may need to increase the vga memory option. Since QEMU 2.9 the default VGA display type is `std` for all OS types besides some Windows versions (XP and older) which use `cirrus`. The `qxl` option enables the SPICE display server. For win* OS you can select how many independent displays you want, Linux guests can add displays themself. You can also run without any graphic card, using a serial device as terminal. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information and available configuration parameters.

deleteUnreferencedDisksOnDestroy.description: Set to true to delete unreferenced disks on destroy (defaults to `true`).

For win* OS you can select how many independent displays you want, Linux guests can add displays themself. You can also run without any graphic card, using a serial device as terminal. proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine:VirtualMachi.description:
## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name` and the `vm_id`, e.g.,

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine:VirtualMachine ubuntu_vm first-node/4321
```

acpi.description: Whether to enable ACPI (defaults to `true`).

amdSev.description: Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) features by AMD CPUs.

bios.description: The BIOS implementation (defaults to `seabios`).

bootOrders.description: Specify a list of devices to boot from in the order they appear in the list.

deleteUnreferencedDisksOnDestroy.description: Whether to delete unreferenced disks on destroy (defaults to `true`)

efiDisk.description: The efi disk device (required if `bios` is set to `ovmf`)

hookScriptFileId.description: The identifier for a file containing a hook script (needs to be executable, e.g. by using the `proxmox_virtual_environment_file.file_mode` attribute).

hostpcis.description: A host PCI device mapping (multiple blocks supported).

ipv4Addresses.description: The IPv4 addresses per network interface published by the QEMU agent (empty list when `agent.enabled` is `false`)

ipv6Addresses.description: The IPv6 addresses per network interface published by the QEMU agent (empty list when `agent.enabled` is `false`)

macAddresses.description:
The MAC addresses published by the QEMU agent with fallback
to the network device configuration, if the agent is disabled

machine.description: The VM machine type (defaults to `pc`).

migrate.description: Migrate the VM on node change instead of re-creating it (defaults to `false`).

name.description: The virtual machine name.

networkInterfaceNames.description: The network interface names published by the QEMU agent (empty list when `agent.enabled` is `false`)

nodeName.description:
The name of the node to assign the virtual machine
to.

onBoot.description: Specifies whether a VM will be started during system boot. (defaults to `true`)

poolId.description: The identifier for a pool to assign the virtual machine to. This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. To assign the VM to a pool, use the `proxmoxve.Pool.Membership` resource instead.
poolId.deprecationMessage: This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. To assign the VM to a pool, use `proxmoxve.Pool.Membership` resource instead.

protection.description: Sets the protection flag of the VM. This will disable the remove VM and remove disk operations (defaults to `false`).

purgeOnDestroy.description: Whether to purge the VM from backup configurations on destroy (defaults to `true`)

reboot.description: Reboot the VM after initial creation (defaults to `false`).

rebootAfterUpdate.description: Reboot the VM after update if needed (defaults to `true`).

rngs.description: The random number generator configuration. Can only be set by `root@pam.`

smbios.description: The SMBIOS (type1) settings for the VM.

started.description: Whether to start the virtual machine (defaults to `true`).

startup.description: Defines startup and shutdown behavior of the VM.

stopOnDestroy.description: Whether to stop rather than shutdown on VM destroy (defaults to `false`)

tabletDevice.description: Whether to enable the USB tablet device (defaults to `true`).

tags.description: A list of tags of the VM. This is only meta information ( defaults to `[]`). Note: Proxmox always sorts the VM tags. If the list in template is not sorted, then Proxmox will always report a difference on the resource. You may use the `ignore_changes` lifecycle meta-argument to ignore changes to this attribute.

template.description: Whether to create a template (defaults to `false`).

timeoutClone.description:
Timeout for cloning a VM in seconds (defaults to
1800).

timeoutCreate.description:
Timeout for creating a VM in seconds (defaults to
1800).

timeoutMigrate.description:
Timeout for migrating the VM (defaults to
1800).

timeoutMoveDisk.deprecationMessage: This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. An overall operation timeout (timeout_create / timeout_clone / timeout_migrate) is used instead.

timeoutReboot.description:
Timeout for rebooting a VM in seconds (defaults
to 1800).

timeoutShutdownVm.description:
Timeout for shutting down a VM in seconds (
defaults to 1800).

timeoutStartVm.description:
Timeout for starting a VM in seconds (defaults
to 1800).

timeoutStopVm.description:
Timeout for stopping a VM in seconds (defaults
to 300).

usbs.description: A host USB device mapping (multiple blocks supported).

watchdog.description: The watchdog configuration. Once enabled (by a guest action), the watchdog must be periodically polled by an agent inside the guest or else the watchdog will reset the guest (or execute the respective action specified).

If the list in template is not sorted, then Proxmox will always report a difference on the resource. You may use the `ignore_changes` lifecycle meta-argument to ignore changes to this attribute.
